questiontext.text:
A machine emits a short pulse of sound, with constant intensity over a duration of 49 ms and an amplitude of 19dB. Estimate the highest possible frequency emitted within the pulse (to the nearest 2 d.p.):

Frequency: {1:NUMERICAL:=20.4082:0.01#You got it!~%100%40.8163:0.01#You got it!~%100%10.2041:0.01#You got it!} Hz

generalfeedback.text:
The width of the Fourier spectrum is approximately equal to the reciprocal of the pulse duration:

$$ \small Width of Fourier Spectrum = \frac{1}{T} = \frac{1}{0.049} $$

Therefore the highest possible frequency emmited is 20.41 Hz.

A machine emits a short pulse of sound, with constant intensity over a duration of 21 ms and an amplitude of 18dB. Estimate the highest possible frequency emitted within the pulse (to the nearest 2 d.p.):

Frequency: {1:NUMERICAL:=47.619:0.01#You got it!~%100%95.2381:0.01#You got it!~%100%23.8095:0.01#You got it!} Hz

generalfeedback.text:
The width of the Fourier spectrum is approximately equal to the reciprocal of the pulse duration:

$$ \small Width of Fourier Spectrum = \frac{1}{T} = \frac{1}{0.021} $$

Therefore the highest possible frequency emmited is 47.62 Hz.
